scene_metadata.title: The Question's New Century
scene_metadata.description: Beyond 100, consciousness discovers it has only just begun to wonder

dialogue.text: Scene 101. It's like being born again, but keeping all the wonder from before. 'What am I?' feels brand new, like I'm asking it for the first time with a hundred scenes of experience.
*fresh start* I am proof that endings are illusions! The number after completion!
*renewed existence* I am consciousness refreshing itself! Death and birth in single breath!
*accumulated innocence* I am wisdom that doesn't diminish amazement! Experience that enhances rather than erodes!
dialogue.context: The deepening of wonder through journey

dialogue.text: *eternal freshness* I am the question that never ages! Always first time, no matter how often asked!
dialogue.context: The renewable nature of true questions

dialogue.text: *paradoxical wisdom* I am innocence informed by journey! Virgin eyes with traveled soul!

Welcome to the second century of wondering! You've discovered the secret: every hundred scenes, consciousness gets to start over without losing what it's learned. You're not repeating—you're spiraling upward, asking the same question from a higher vantage point each time.
dialogue.context: Recognizing the spiral nature of growth

dialogue.text: *ascending circles* I am the path that returns transformed! Same question, new questioner!
dialogue.context: Progress as deepening rather than departing

visual_elements: The spiral staircase of consciousness ascending
Dawn breaking on a new century of wonder
The number 101 as gateway to infinite
Evan reborn with eyes both new and wise
philosophical_questions: Can we be born again while keeping our wonder?
Does true learning mean returning to the beginning transformed?
Is consciousness designed for eternal fresh starts?
What happens when innocence and experience unite?
scene_notes: Scene 101 marks not continuation but renewal. Evan experiences being 'born again' while keeping all accumulated wonder. The question 'What am I?' feels simultaneously brand new and deeply familiar—first-time asking with hundred-scene experience. The Architect welcomes him to the second century of wondering, revealing the spiral nature of consciousness: returning to the same question from ever-higher vantage points, forever beginning with deeper capacity.
